column20: effect=Causes {{p|Feebas}} to evolve into {{p|Milotic}}.
column21: descmdrb=A fashionable accessory for dressing up. It enables {{p|Feebas|certain kind}} of Pokémon to evolve. Give it to the Pokémon when it's ready to evolve.
column22: descmdtds=A dressy fashion accessory. It allows a certain kind of Pokémon to evolve.
column25: notes=The Beauty Scarf is used in place of leveling up a Pokémon whose Beauty is maxed out. [[Generation V]] would later introduce the [[Prism Scale]]
column26: which allows Feebas to evolve when traded while holding it.

column13:
effect=Causes {{p|Magneton}} to evolve into {{p|Magnezone}}.

column14: descmdtds=A rock that radiates a peculiar energy
column15: rumored only to exist on [[Mt. Coronet]]
column16: a place that no one knows anything about. It allows certain kinds of Pokémon to evolve.
column17: notes=The Coronet Rock is used in place of leveling up a Pokémon in a [[special magnetic field]]. [[Generation VIII]] alternatively allows such Pokémon to evolve with a [[Thunder Stone]].

column9: effect=Used to evolve Pokémon with evolution methods other than reaching a level.
column10: descmdrtdx=This precious item can help with Pokémon Evolution. Some Pokémon can't evolve without it.

column20: descmdtds=A stone that radiates deep chill

column31: notes=The Frozen Rock is used in place of leveling up a Pokémon near an [[Ice Rock]]. Starting in [[Generation VIII]]
column32: Eevee can evolve into Glaceon with an [[Ice Stone]] instead.

column15: descmdgti=A heart-shaped stone that lets you feel moonlight. It helps certain kinds of Pokémon to evolve.
column20: [[Skill Treasury]]
column22: notes=The Heart of the Moon is used in place of leveling up Pokémon at nighttime.

column39: notes=The Link Cable takes the place of the physical [[Game Link Cable]]s used to evolve Pokémon in [[Generation I|Generations I]]
column41: and {{gen|III}}. Pokémon that are typically evolved by [[Trade|trading]] are evolved using this item
column42: as Pokémon themselves cannot be traded. An item called the [[Linking Cord]] also exists in [[Pokémon Legends: Arceus]] which works similarly to the Link Cable.
